title: Matching beginners with higher level players is creating a toxic environment
body: Ok, so I'm not very good at League. I readily admit it, and won't pretend otherwise. Yet for some reason, all of my recent games (playing in normal draft as a level 27) have seen me matched with players at a very wide range of skill levels - including Golds, Platinums, and Diamonds, in addition to the bronze and silver players who are closer to my skill level. This leads to a pretty wide skill imbalance, which is frustrating for both the lower level players like me and the higher level players playing with me. It almost always leads to someone raging about how trash I am. Of course, some players will offer advice, but they are in the minority. Is this matching of lower-skilled champions with higher-ranked champions a mistake, or purposeful? If it's purposeful, I feel to see the point - it would be great if the better players offered constructive criticism, but that's sadly not something most League players do. I am being notified that a lot of my reports are going through, but I can't help but feel like matchmaking is lacking at the moment.

Yes, it is a problem. Smurfing is an issue that is very hard to solve. When a newer player feels frustrated like you have been and the older, more experienced, players have to play with someone that is not at the same level, toxicity runs rampant. Once you get to a certain level you expect things that newer players may not do or understand. This is most easily seen in the bot lane.

It is frustrating, but I don't see any way around it. However, once you hit 30 your normal mmr will hopefully level out a bit and you will see more stability.
Smurfs who rage at low levels are trash anyway. Ignore them or pity them or something. They are cowards who can't fight fair. I dunno.
I'm in Bronze 5 (Yeah I know) and I hardly see anybody higher than Bronze when I play. The only time I really see Gold or higher is with my friends. Which are on my team anyways.
I felt the same way, found out there simply isn't enough players around your level range (right now you are lvl 27) so they match you with players who are higher lvled.

When you hit 30 you will be matched with all developmentally disabled people and you will miss getting plats on your team in norms.

Enjoy it for now, and if everyone is pro on your team pick a tanky char and focus on CS and not dying.

Remember you don't have to "win" your lane.  You just have to do better than the other lane or go even.
